description: From Middle English bewelden, equivalent to be- +‎ wield.

verbs.description: bewield (third-person singular simple present bewields, present participle bewielding, simple past and past participle bewielded)

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare) To hold in hand; rule; control; manage; handle; wield.
examples: No grey goose quills the weapons used ;—a walking cane one feller With puissant arm bewielded, and the other his umbrella.
